Indian Economy.title: Indonesia to Continue Talks on Jets, Minerals After Tariffs Deal
Indian Economy.summary: Indonesia will keep talking with the US on sectoral tariffs, jet purchases and critical minerals after securing a 19% baseline tariff rate on exports to the world’s largest economy, a government adviser said Thursday.

Indian Economy.title: China Vows to Address ‘Irrational Competition’ in EV Sector
Indian Economy.summary: China pledged to rein in “irrational competition” in its electric vehicle sector, reflecting authorities’ increasing urgency to tackle deflationary price wars threatening economic and industrial growth.

Indian Economy.title: TSMC Raises 2025 Outlook in a Big Boost for AI Demand Hopes
Indian Economy.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. raised its outlook for 2025 revenue growth, shoring up investors’ confidence in the momentum of the global AI spending spree.
Indian Economy.title: Mint Quick Edit | External front stability: Good news, but not entirely
Indian Economy.summary: Despite global turbulence, India’s external balances are well within safety limits in the context of the economy’s macro stability. Capital flows, though, have been disappointing.

Indian Economy.title: India’s informal sector isn’t off the map: It’s being tracked better than ever
Indian Economy.summary: Arguments of GDP over- or under-estimation fall flat in the face of statistical progress made by India to measure this sector closely. The timeliness and regularity of NSS data have improved and surveys suggest this sector’s growth has lately been robust.

Indian Economy.title: Reduce friction: Let regulated stablecoins transform India’s remittance economy
Indian Economy.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has a digital currency under trial, but it may be time for RBI-regulated rupee-pegged stablecoins to help expand the adoption of blockchain-based money. Stablecoins can make global money transfers more efficient and also enhanc…

Indian Economy.title: Barry Eichengreen: Germany’s budget expansion makes sense while America’s is reckless
Indian Economy.summary: Berlin is relaxing its austerity rule for good reasons—such as security and long-term growth—while Washington appears to have abandoned all fiscal responsibility with Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill. Where this will leave the US is a question we can’t duck.

Stock Market.title: Q1 earnings: Market rebound to power up listed AMCs in the June quarter
Stock Market.summary: Sustained SIP inflows, rising investor participation, and a favorable asset mix will likely improve listed AMCs profitability, say experts.

Stock Market.title: Wipro starts the year slow but pins hopes on large deals
Stock Market.summary: Wipro became India’s third large IT outsourcer to cut headcount in the first quarter, joining HCL Technologies and Tech Mahindra, which signals murkier waters ahead for India’s information technology services sector.

Startups & Funding.title: Chiratae-backed Uniphore Technologies in talks to raise up to $250 million
Startups & Funding.summary: The conversational AI startup is seeking fresh capital to fuel global expansion and deepen its AI bets.

Startups & Funding.title: Avendus-Hurun U30 Youngest leaders 2025 list: Zepto co-founders take crown; check full list
Startups & Funding.summary: Avendus Wealth-Hurun India has launched the U30 List for 2025, which recognises 79 young leaders in India, aged 30 and below, “who are redefining the future of Indian enterprise”. Here are the youngest on this list…

Startups & Funding.title: Avendus-Hurun U30 India: Mumbai leads among cities with featured millionaires, Anant Ambani on list
Startups & Funding.summary: Avendus-Hurun U30 India 2025: Maharashtra leads with 21 entrants in the Avendus-Hurun U30 List 2025, followed by Karnataka with 10 and Rajasthan with 9. Mumbai tops cities with 15 young leaders, including Anant Ambani.

Banking & Finance.title: Relief for borrowers as RBI’s guidelines on loan prepayment to come into force from January 1
Banking & Finance.summary: RBI early this month released a set of guidelines on pre-payment charges on loans which will be applicable to all commercial banks (excluding payments banks), cooperative banks and NBFCs. These will come into force from January 1 next year

Banking & Finance.title: What is a CIF number and why it is key to your bank account access
Banking & Finance.summary: The CIF number in banking is a unique identifier that links all your accounts and personal data, enabling streamlined digital banking, faster service access, and improved financial security.

Banking & Finance.title: “Sir, we’re activating your credit card”—How one call almost emptied your bank account
Banking & Finance.summary: After receiving a new credit card, Abhishek Walia received a suspicious call asking for his OTP for activation. Trusting his instincts, he contacted customer care and discovered a fraud attempt.

Banking & Finance.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks closed today, on July 17, for death anniversary of U Tirot Singh? Check full schedule…
Banking & Finance.summary: Bank holiday today: Banks in Shillong are closed today, on July 17 (Thursday), for the Khasi onserva of the death anniversary of U Tirot Singh. Here’s the full schedule…

Banking & Finance.title: Elevated slippages, change in NPA classification weigh on Axis Bank’s bottomline in Q1
Banking & Finance.summary: Axis Bank reported a weaker first-quarter performance, with net profit dropping 4% year-on-year and 18% sequentially to  ₹5,806 crore, mainly due to elevated retail unsecured slippages and a shift in its non-performing asset classification norms.

Technology Sector.title: Mint Explainer: Will FY26 be a washout year for the IT services industry?
Technology Sector.summary: The latest earnings reports reveal a turbulent time for IT services, with companies grappling with tariff impacts and shifting client demands. What lies ahead for the industry in FY26?

Technology Sector.title: Humour can’t save the world but deserves a chance anyway
Technology Sector.summary: It’s not an indulgence. It keeps us human in a world that can feel transactional, helps us cope with stress and offers perspective. But where has all the humour vanished? Don’t let it go missing in action.

Technology Sector.title: CAFE puzzle: Tailpipes must not get to wag India’s car market
Technology Sector.summary: India’s proposed CAFE norms will disadvantage makers of small cars unless we rethink the formula for carbon targets. We shouldn’t let policy distort incentives in favour of big vehicles. Here’s a formula that could work.

Technology Sector.title: Mint Quick Edit | Farming has regained policy attention
Technology Sector.summary: India’s government has a new scheme to help farms in areas where farming lags. It’s a statist approach, but market oriented proposals have made little headway with farmers—and there’s no doubt they need help.

Technology Sector.title: Aim for the long haul: Frame a ropeway policy in aid of urban mobility
Technology Sector.summary: This ‘touristy’ mode of transport is energy efficient and cost effective. It can be integrated with larger transit systems to serve regular commuters, covering medium-density corridors and offering last-mile links. Here’s how policy can lead the way.
